title: Mother, 23, got five-year-old daughter to stop eating ONLY Turkey dinosaurs using colourful chart
text:
A mother got her five-year-old daughter to stop eating only turkey dinosaurs and waffles and try greens, salmon fish cake and Quorn cottage pie by creating a colourful wall chart.

Music theatre graduate Karis Turner, 23, from Heywood, Manchester, writes Scarlett-Mai's new meals onto the board, and puts a happy sticker next to each she liked and a sad one next to each she did not.

However, thanks to the genius hack, the single mother said her daughter is now eating everything - and her new favourite meal is cheesy leek and ham pie.

Music theatre graduate Karis Turner, 23, got her five-year-old daughter Scarlett-Mai to stop eating only turkey dinosaurs and waffles by creating a colourful wall chart, which she is holding up above

Her daughter, pictured above tucking into potato, carrots and peas, has now munched her way through greens, salmon fish cakes and Quorn cottage pie and found a new favourite meal - cheesy leak and ham pie.

The single mum rewards her daughter's healthier choices with stickers and medals weekly - motivating Scarlett-Mai to ditch the dinosaurs.

Karis said: 'Scarlett-Mai wasn’t getting the nutrients she needs because she would refuse to eat anything but classic child dinners, such as waffles and dinosaurs.

'I thought if I made trying new foods fun and a competition, she would be encouraged to change her ways.

'I purchased some plastic medals, trophies and printed off certificates, and bought some happy and sad stickers to show what she liked and disliked.

Scarlett-Mai's mother puts either a happy or sad sticker next to each meal she tried depending on whether she liked it or not

Karis has also purchased some medals, trophies and printed off certificates for her daughter

'But so far, we have only had to use the smiley stickers because she's loved everything, and she can’t believe it.

'Before the chart, she wouldn’t even have a spoonful of anything that looked different to what she is used to. But now she likes chicken curry, all-day vegetarian breakfast and lots of vegetables.

'She just needed a push into the right direction and now that we have got the momentum going, it is easy.

'I am able to pick her school dinners online and we sit down and discuss what she would like to try. She can have two stickers if she steps out of her comfort zone.

'At the end of the week, if she has eaten all her dinners, I give her a medal and we can do an activity of her choice like baking.

'Scarlett-Mai now enjoys most foods and she gets so excited to tell me at the end of school - her new favourite dish is cheesy leek and ham pie.'

Single mother, pictured with Scarlett-Mai on her graduation day, also said her daughter's schoolwork has improved thanks to the genius hack

The idea sprung to mind after the mother introduced a reading book chart and noticed Scarlett-Mai’s enthusiasm towards books had changed.

She picks five books a week to read and is rewarded with stickers – Karis says even her teachers have noticed the improvement.

She adds: 'Kids need a push in the right direction, and I have helped Scarlett-Mai by using my imagination.

'These days a lot of parents my age are glued to their phones and only half-heartedly help their kids with homework and reading.

The mother from Heywood, Manchester, pictured holding her daughter, said she decided on the idea after a reading chart encouraged her daughter to look at more books

'Whereas I make sure I dedicate 30 minutes of my day to Scarlett-Mai’s reading without any distractions.

'It has made our relationship stronger and her confidence is sky high. She is getting better and better.

'I was told at parents evening that her reading has improved, and she has started to buckle down at school.

'Kids love to feel appreciated and the extra half an hour reading every night means the world to her.

'She receives a certificate for her reading which only takes me a few minutes to create, but they mean so much to her and gives her a sense of accomplishment.'

To see more of Karis and Scarlett-Mai follow @youngmumsdiaries on Instagram..
description: Music theatre graduate Karis Turner, 23, from Heywood, Manchester, got daughter Scarlett-Mai to try greens, salmon fish cake, Quorn cottage pie and others using a colourful wall chart.
